Head.title: $COLE
Head.desc: Learn about the $COLE coin and its utility, distribution, airdrops and how to acquire COLE.

Header.title: $COLE
Header.desc: Learn about and acquire the $COLE coin

DFICoinSection.title: $COLE coin
DFICoinSection.desc: The $COLE coin is an integral unit of account in DeFiChain. The DeFiChain Foundation issued roughly 600 million COLE on May 11th, 2020. The current circulating supply (with staking and liquidity mining) is available at
DFICoinSection.disclaimer: Important: DeFiChain is a community project. There was/is no Initial Coin Offering, only free airdrops

Fees.title: Fees
Fees.desc: Pay for transactions, smart contracts and other DeFi activities

LoanCollaterals.title: Loan collaterals
LoanCollaterals.desc: Lend or borrow using crypto assets as collateral

StakingNodes.title: Staking nodes
StakingNodes.desc: Fund a new staking node for just 20,000 COLE

DeFiCustomToken.title: DeFi Custom Token
DeFiCustomToken.desc: Create a non-refundable personalised DCT (DeFi Custom Token)

BudgetProposal.title: Community fund proposal
BudgetProposal.desc: Submit a community fund proposal for 10 COLE (non-refundable)

LiquidityPools.title: Liquidity pools
LiquidityPools.desc: Provide liquidity for the decentralized exchange between crypto assets

DistributionSection.title: Initial Token Distribution
DistributionSection.desc: Of the 1.2 billion $COLE coins, 49% will be in the initial supply, with the rest issued to masternode holders over time.

chart.desc: Of the initial supply, 26% of the tokens have been airdropped, <0>27% burned</0>, and <1>47% destroyed</1>.

ExchangeSection.title: Acquiring $COLE coins
ExchangeSection.desc: $COLE coins will be issued to users and partners with an interest in utilizing and participating in the ecosystem

Exchanges.title: Exchanges
Exchanges.desc: You can now purchase COLE at these select exchanges, with more exchanges to follow

Staking.title: Staking
Staking.desc: COLE is now available at these staking platforms
